com.foreach.across.modules.dynamicforms.domain.document

Class DynamicDocumentWorkspace

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.dynamicforms.domain.document.DynamicDocumentWorkspace

  • @NotThreadSafe
 @Component
 @Scope(value="prototype")
public class DynamicDocumentWorkspace
extends Object
    The DynamicDocumentWorkspace is a central, stateful component for working with a DynamicDocument. It manages data, allows for type conversion, definition upgrading and saving the document. An instance should be created through the DynamicDocumentService.

    A DynamicDocumentWorkspace can also be used as a target for databinding. If the workspace is set as a property of the DataBinder target, then it is imperative that setDataBinderTarget(String) was called with the correct property prefix or binding exceptions will not return the correct property name.

    NOTE: a DynamicDocumentWorkspace is always attached to a single document, not thread-safe and not meant for caching. You can use the same workspace for multiple documents by switching document using loadNewDocument() or loadDocument(DynamicDocument) methods. For performance, a workspace caches the different definitions it has loaded.

    You can also configure a custom shared cache with setDefinitionCache(Map). You can disable the default caching behaviour using setCacheDefinitions(boolean).

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    DynamicDocumentService

    • Method Detail

      • setCacheDefinitions

        public void setCacheDefinitions(boolean cacheDefinitions)
        Should the worskspace cache definitions that have previously been loaded. Default is true meaning that switching documents or versions in the same workspace will have better performance since it will avoid parsing definitions if they have previously been loaded.

        If you plan to use the same workspace instance for a long time (you shouldn't though), you should put this value to false. You can also externalize the cache to use by setting it with setDefinitionCache(Map).

        Parameters:
        cacheDefinitions - true if definitions should be cached

      • setCalculatedFieldsEnabled

        public void setCalculatedFieldsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        When enabled, calculated fields will always be re-calculated when fetched. If disabled, the last calculated value will be returned instead and you must update them manually using updateCalculatedFields().

        The workspace will always update the calculate fields before saving the document.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if calculated fields should be enabled

      • isCalculatedFieldsEnabled

        public boolean isCalculatedFieldsEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if calculated fields are enabled

      • updateCalculatedFields

        public void updateCalculatedFields()
        Recalculates all calculated fields in this document and updates the cached value. The workspace will always update the calculate fields before saving the document.

        If you want instant calculation of fields, you should set setCalculatedFieldsEnabled(boolean) to true.

      • hasErrors

        public boolean hasErrors()
        Check if errors occurred when loading the current document version in the workspace. The detailed report can be retrieved using getReport() though several workspace methods will immediately return the report as well.
        Returns:
        true if errors occured when initializing the workspace (loading a specific document version)

      • getBinderMap

        public Map<String,Object> getBinderMap()
        Get a DynamicDocumentDataAsMapAdapter for the current document data. The adapter is ready to be used on a DataBinder target.
        Returns:
        fields binder
        See Also:
        setDataBinderTarget(String)

      • validate

        public void validate(@NonNull
                     org.springframework.validation.Errors errors)
        Validate the current document fields, using the external binding result for registering the errors. This assumes that the workspace is a property on the BindingResult.getTarget() and the dataBinderTarget has been registered with that property name.

        The field errors will generate a valid bean path to the actual field value.

        This will NOT validate the document name or version label, which is also required for a document.

        Parameters:
        errors - in which to register the errors

      • validate

        public org.springframework.validation.Errors validate()
        Performs standalone validation of the currently loaded document. Returns an Errors instance holding the different errors that have been registered. Any fields will be reported as the exact path to that field.

        This will NOT validate the document name or version label, which is also required for a document.

        Returns:
        errors instance

      • setDataBinderTarget

        public void setDataBinderTarget(String dataBinderTarget)
        Set the property on a databinder target that this workspace is bound to. This will ensure the getBinderMap() throws exceptions with the correct property names for Spring validation handling.
        Parameters:
        dataBinderTarget - property name

      • changeDocumentVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report changeDocumentVersion(@NonNull
                                                              DynamicDocumentVersion version)
        Load the specific version of the document into this workspace. Note that it is possible that something goes wrong when loading the version, for example if a field can no longer be retrieved.

        Though this should rarely happen for a known version (attached to a fixed definition that should theoretically not change), the workspace is very lenient and returns a DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report with information about fields that failed.

        This method can only be used to load a document version of the same document currently loaded in the workspace. If you want to switch the workspace to another document altogether, use loadDocument(DynamicDocument).

        Parameters:
        version - that should be used
        Returns:
        report with errors

                            Object value)
        Set a single field value.
        Parameters:
        field - to set
        value - to set
        Returns:
        previous value for that field

      • findFieldValue

        public <T> Optional<T> findFieldValue(String field)
        Find the field value, null will be returned if that field does not exist, else the optional will hold the value of the field.
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected value type, will perform cast
        Parameters:
        field - to find
        Returns:
        null if no such field, else an optional with the value

      • getFieldValue

        public <T,V extends T> V getFieldValue(String field,
                                       @NonNull
                                       Class<T> returnType)
        Get the field value, optionally performing type conversion using the bound ConversionService. This will throw an exception if there is no ConversionService set on the workspace.
        Type Parameters:
        T - return type parameter
        V - specific return type, will cast after conversion
        Parameters:
        field - to get the value for
        returnType - to which the value should be converted
        Returns:
        field value in the type specified

      • findFieldValue

        public <T,V extends T> Optional<V> findFieldValue(String field,
                                                  Class<T> returnType)
        Get the field value, optionally performing type conversion using the bound ConversionService. This will throw an exception if there is no ConversionService set on the workspace.

        Will return null if there is no such field present.

        Type Parameters:
        T - return type parameter
        V - specific return type, will cast after conversion
        Parameters:
        field - to get the value for
        returnType - to which the value should be converted
        Returns:
        field value in the type specified

      • exportFields

        public <T> T exportFields(String format)

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • importFields

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        report of the fields imported

      • importFieldsFromVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report importFieldsFromVersion(@NonNull
                                                                DynamicDocumentVersion version)
        Import set of fields from another document version. The version does not need to have the same base document definition, but can be from any type of document.
        Parameters:
        version - whose fields to import
        Returns:
        report of the fields imported

      • importFields

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report importFields(@NonNull
                                                     Object data,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     String format)
        Import data in an arbitrary format into the current document. A valid DynamicDocumentDataMapper needs to be registered for the specific format, in order to be able to import the data.
        Parameters:
        data - object to import (should not be null)
        format - of the data object, used to fetch a DynamicDocumentDataMapper
        Returns:
        report of the fields imported

      • createNewVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report createNewVersion(boolean useLatestDefinition)
        Create a new version for the current document. Depending on the parameter value, the latest definition version (true) will be used for the new version, or the same definition of the currently loaded version will be used (false).

        When using the latest definition, it is possible that some values could not be loaded, in that case the report will contain the details.

        Parameters:
        useLatestDefinition - true if the latest definition version should be used
        Returns:
        report with information about field values (never null)

      • createNewVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report createNewVersion(@NonNull
                                                         DynamicDefinitionVersion newDefinitionVersion)
        Create a new version for the current document, using the specific definition version. Any fields of the current version that could not be set in the new definition will be present as an error in the report.
        Parameters:
        newDefinitionVersion - to use for the new document version
        Returns:
        report with information about field values (never null)

      • changeToLatestDefinitionVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report changeToLatestDefinitionVersion()
        Change the currently loaded document version to use the latest definition version. The report will contain information about fields that could not be set in the upgraded document version.
        Returns:
        report with information about field values (never null)

      • changeDefinitionVersion

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader.Report changeDefinitionVersion(@NonNull
                                                                DynamicDefinitionVersion newDefinitionVersion)
        Change the currently loaded document version to use the specific definition version. The report will contain information about fields that could not be set in the upgraded document version.
        Parameters:
        newDefinitionVersion - to use
        Returns:
        report with information about field values (never null)

      • loadNewDocument

        public void loadNewDocument()
        Load a new document in this workspace. This will re-initialize the workspace with a blank document for the currently loaded definition version.

      • loadNewDocument

        public void loadNewDocument(@NonNull
                            DynamicDefinition documentDefinition)
        Load a new document in this workspace, using the document definition specified. This will re-initialize the workspace with a blank document using the latest version of the document definition.
        Parameters:
        documentDefinition - definition whose latest version to use for the new document

      • loadNewDocument

        public void loadNewDocument(@NonNull
                            DynamicDefinitionVersion definitionVersion)
        Load a new (blank) document in this workspace, using the document definition version specified. This will re-initialize the workspace with a blank document using the definition version.
        Parameters:
        definitionVersion - definition version to use for the new document

      • loadDocument

        public void loadDocument(@NonNull
                         DynamicDocument document)
        Load another document in this workspace. This will re-initialize the entire workspace to use the document and accompanying definition. The latest document version will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        document - to load

      • loadDocument

        public void loadDocument(@NonNull
                         DynamicDocumentVersion documentVersion)
        Load another document in this workspace. This will re-initialize the entire workspace to use that document and accompanying definition. The specific document version will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        documentVersion - to load

      • save

        public DynamicDocumentVersion save()
        Saves the current workspace, this will save a new version of the document, and immediately switch the current workspace to a new version. Subsquent modifications of the workspace are done in isolation.
        Returns:
        the new version record that has been created (or the same if it was updated)

      • createDataLoader

        public DynamicDocumentDataLoader createDataLoader()
        Create a DynamicDocumentDataLoader for the currently loaded document version.
        Returns:
        data loader

      • setDefinitionCache

        @Generated(value="lombok")
public void setDefinitionCache(@NonNull
                                                          Map<Long,DynamicDocumentDefinition> definitionCache)
        Set a (non-null) definition cache that should be used by this workspace. The key is the definition id. Any definition loaded by this workspace will be fetched from the cache, or - if missing - stored into it.

      • setAllowVersionUpdates

        @Generated(value="lombok")
public void setAllowVersionUpdates(boolean allowVersionUpdates)
        Set to true if you want to allow an existing (saved) version of a document to be updated. Defaults to false to avoid accidental updating of an existing version as that would be rewriting history... something you usually do not want.
